channel.title: Ronnie James Dio on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Ronnie James Dio on My New Hugo Site

item.title: I Wanna Trademark Things All Night
item.description: [big]Gene Simmons, love him or hate him, has a history of trademarking very common things.[/big] As any fan of the Scottish power-pop group Teenage Fanclub knows, the band’s label, Geffen, had to send a check to Simmons because the cover of the alternative rock band’s Bandwagonesque (which is a stellar album) featured a sack of money with a dollar sign on it—an image that Gene Simmons has long owned the trademark for, as it was the logo of his label, Simmons Records.
